_header: My lief life that livest in wealth
_description: A warning spoken by the soul of a dead person — eight quatrains (abab)

Bod789.First Lines:
Mi leeve liif þat lyvest in welþeIn mete and drinke and
                    fayr schroud…
Bod789.Last Lines:
…þanne may he sikir of heven beWhanne he schal in
                    erþe be laid
Bod789.Attributed Title:
Here is a good counseil for synful men to take heede to while þei ben
                    in þis liif (f. 149)
Bod789.Editions:
Woolf,  Rosemary. 
             The English Religious Lyric in the Middle Ages.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1968: 317-18.
Hirsh,  John C. 
             “Prayer and Meditation in Late Mediaeval England: MS. Bodley
                789.” 
             Medium Ævum
         48 (1979): 55-66: 61-2.
